sentence: Home improvement warehouse operator The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) on Thursday saw its price target cut by analysts at Barclays Capital.
The firm lowered its target for HD to $37 from $40, noting that home improvement spending continues to be volatile.
That new target represents a 32% upside to the stock's Wednesday closing price of $28.07.
Barclays maintained its "Overweight" rating on the stock.
Home Depot shares were mostly flat in premarket trading Thursday.
We had removed shares of HD from our recommended list back on May 25, when the stock was trading at $33.22.
The company has a 3.35% dividend yield, based on last night's closing stock price of $28.07.
The stock has technical support in the $25 price area.
If the shares can firm up, we see overhead resistance around the $32 price levels.
We would remain on the sidelines for now.
The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) is not recommended at this time, holding a Dividend.com DARSâ„¢ Rating of 3.4 out of 5 stars.
